de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.index.tree.spatial.kd

Class MinimalisticMemoryKDTree<O extends NumberVector>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.index.AbstractIndex<O>
      • de.lmu.ifi.dbs.elki.index.tree.spatial.kd.MinimalisticMemoryKDTree<O>
  • Type Parameters:
    O - Vector type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Index, KNNIndex<O>, RangeIndex<O>, Result

    @Reference(authors="J. L. Bentley",
           title="Multidimensional binary search trees used for associative searching",
           booktitle="Communications of the ACM, Vol. 18 Issue 9, Sept. 1975",
           url="http://dx.doi.org/10.1145/361002.361007")
public class MinimalisticMemoryKDTree<O extends NumberVector>
extends AbstractIndex<O>
implements KNNIndex<O>, RangeIndex<O>
    Simple implementation of a static in-memory K-D-tree. Does not support dynamic updates or anything, but also is very simple and memory efficient: all it uses is one ArrayModifiableDBIDs to sort the data in a serialized tree. Reference:

    J. L. Bentley
    Multidimensional binary search trees used for associative searching
    Communications of the ACM, Vol. 18 Issue 9, Sept. 1975

    The version SmallMemoryKDTree uses 3x more memory, but is considerably faster because it keeps a local copy of the attribute values, thus reducing the number of accesses to the relation substantially. In particular, this reduces construction time. TODO: add support for weighted Minkowski distances.
    Author:
    Erich Schubert
